description:
Ninjas still exist in Japan today. They number around 200,000. The ninja organization NIN (National Intelligence of NINJA) is not controlled by the civilian government, with its elite members performing assassinations and sabotage in secret. There is an organization that opposes NIN: UN (Under Ninja). Ninja versus ninja: What lies waiting at the end of this shadowy feud?

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

name.native: マキシム・コレスニク
コンビニのおばちゃん

node.description:
Won the Topic Award of the 2005 Sense of Gender Awards for Ressentiment and was nominated for the 3rd, 4th and 5th Manga Taisho for I Am a Hero. He formerly worked as Osamu Uoto's assistant. He is married to the mangaka Julie Okamoto, who is his assistant in some of his manga.

[Website](https://kengohanazawa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanamanko) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kengohanazawa/)
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1521695330)

Currently working as a freelancer, having previously worked for [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) and [D.A.S.T.](https://anilist.co/studio/6255/)

Yuuki graduated from Saitama Prefectural Toda Shoyo High School and has been active in the school's "Manga and Anime Research Interest Club.” He found business in the National Health Insurance but couldn't give up on being an animator, so he left and became an animator instead. Has collaborated with director [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/) many times, including on his most famous work, [The Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/).

He works on doujinshi under the circles The Man in the High Castle and Ubik, both references to the works of American science fiction author Philip K. Dick. The published doujinshi include key animation from his body of work and specially drawn manga. On the other hand, since he worked on Ralphilia Saga by [Akara Arisato](https://anilist.co/staff/149449/), he has been involved in several works as a guest member of the doujin circle La Moon.

__[Website](http://kroi.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KroiOfficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc9CJVSnJx5WTq8E9T4bIoA)__

__Introduction:__
A five-piece band with a mixed musical style that incorporates influences from all music genres, including R&B, funk, soul, rock, and hip-hop. Formed in Tokyo in February 2018, they debuted with their 1st single "Suck a Lemmon" in October of the same year. In June 2021, they made their major debut with their 1st album "LENS". In addition to music activities, each member engages in a variety of activities such as fashion modeling, design, and song production.

__Members:__
[Leo Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/324833/Leo-Uchida) (内田怜央) – Vocals, Guitar
Yuki Hasebe (長谷部悠生) – Guitar
Masanori Seki (関将典) – Bass
Daiki Chiba (千葉大樹) – Keyboard
Hidetomo Masuda (益田英知) – Drums

__[Website](http://kroi.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KroiOfficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc9CJVSnJx5WTq8E9T4bIoA)__
